title: What is the Metaverse?
description: In today's episode for 10th August 2021, we discuss the Metaverse and see why so many tech companies are spending billions to realize this dream

title: The dream of digital ownership, powered by the metaverse | Yat Siu
description: Technologist Yat Siu believes the "open metaverse" -- a decentralized version of the internet also known as web3 -- is laying the foundation for a freer, fairer, more prosperous society. In a future-focused talk, he explores the transformative possibilities of web3, from enabling digital ownership and the creator economy to providing a much-needed update to capitalism.

title: Solving Real-World Problems through the Metaverse, with Shara Senderoff of Futureverse
description: In today's episode of The Metaverse Podcast, we talk to Shara Senderoff, co-founder of Futureverse, with the mission to empower developers to create the worlds they imagine through their comprehensive technology platform. Shara is joined by our host and founder, Jamie Burke, discussing the evolving landscape of the metaverse, Web3, and technology entrepreneurship. If you are a Web3 founder, tech founder, or simply curious about metaverse technologies, this episode is for you. You will: Gain insights into Shara's journey from the entertainment industry to Web3, highlighting the importance of audience understanding and data in shaping the future of content and technology. Explore the transformative potential of the metaverse and AI, focusing on the convergence of separate digital elements like finance, media, and social commerce. Gain insights into Futureverse as a multifaceted tech stack designed to empower developers and accelerate business, featuring blockchain, protocols, tools, and content. Discover the value of Ripple's focus on human interaction and long-term vision for interoperability in blockchain tech, offering an asset and solution-driven approach to development. Explore the philosophy that the Open Metaverse will be a collective effort, highlighting the need for entrepreneurial innovation and experimentation to solve real-world problems, not just create games.  Gain insights into the challenges and opportunities in activating unused intellectual property (IP) and the importance of product-market fit in tech entrepreneurship.   Â  Applications for Futureverse Base Camp are open! Are you building on The Root Network? > Apply here. title: 'Your NFTs Are Finally Worthless...?' Or Is It Late Bear Market Clickbait? + The Latest News
description: Recently lots of mainstream publications including Rolling Stone ran an article referencing that 95% of NFTs are now worthless...but who wrote the article? Is it true and is it a clear late bear market signal?  We also dive into the release of one of the latest, very impressive VR headsets to be released and talk about Yuga Labs' Otherside + why it looks like they've replaced their key builders. title: A Reality Check on Fashion and the Metaverse
description: BoFâ€™s Marc Bain and a group of panellists break down the state of web3 in fashion and where the technology is headed.Background:Over the last couple of years, the fashion industry couldnâ€™t stop talking about the potential of NFTs, the metaverse, known in tech industry speak as web3. Now, the fervour around web3 hasÂ cooled and the speculators are long gone. But for those committed to the web3 space, the work continues, even as the discussion has shifted.â€œPeople are pulling back, but people are investing,â€ said Brian Trunzo, metaverse lead at Polygon Labs. â€œIf folks are still at the education stage, doing research either internally or through agencies, they may have cut budgets and pulled back a little bit, whereas folks who have beefed up and built out teams to execute against their web3 strategy, who have had that requisite education, they're doubling down.â€This week on The BoF Podcast, we share a conversation from The BoF Professional Summit: An Inflection Point in Fashion Tech, whereÂ our technology correspondent Marc Bain speaks with three web3 experts â€”Â Brian Trunzo, Alice Delahunt, founder and CEO of Syky, and Milton Pedraza, the founder and CEO of consulting firm the Luxury Institute â€” to debate the future of web3 and fashion.Â Key Insights:â€œSomething that we say in web3 is that it's not so much a bear market, it's a build market,â€ says Trunzo. Rather than letting a drop in investments define how brands should approach the digital world, consider the performance of the brands that are actually putting resources towards building in the space.Â Still, there are details that still need to be figured out, the panellists acknowledged. For Delahunt, purchasing a digital Gucci bag on Roblox made her realise how murky digital ownership could be, because virtual items must exist on the platform where theyâ€™re purchased. She believes blockchain has the power to change that standard. â€œThink about the physical world. Weâ€™ll go out on the street and there's public infrastructure that is owned by the US governmentâ€¦ Itâ€™s public, but private enterprise sits on top of it,â€ she said. â€œI think of the blockchain as the public infrastructure that people start to build on.â€According to Pedraza, this idea of digital identity will only become more paramount as the lines between the online and offline worlds continue to blur. â€œThe technology keeps evolvingâ€¦ but the core principles of data identity, controlling your identity, taking control, monetising or doing whatever you want with your dataâ€¦ will all be supported by these emerging technologies,â€ he said.No matter whatâ€™s trending, Delahunt said the fact that digital tools like Blender and Fortnite can free users of the physical worldâ€™s limits. â€œYou've always wanted to be a butterfly, you are not confined in the same way physicallyâ€¦ and your ability to express yourselves in those spaces will inevitably be a huge part of the future,â€ said Delahunt.Additional Resources:How AI and Web3 Are Shaping Fashionâ€™s Future: At BoFâ€™s tech summit experts in technology and creative innovators share their insights on how emerging technologies are impacting the fashion industry.Â To subscribe to the BoF Podcast, please follow this link. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

title: What is the Metaverse and how does it affect me?
description: Join Newsletter get Free Gift:https://mailchi.mp/5e4f8e9f90e7/untitled-pageLeave us a VoiceMailhttps://www.speakpipe.com/thingsyoushouldknow**Support the Podcast**SuperCast: https://thingsyoushouldknow.supercast.comPatreon:Â  https://www.patreon.com/thingsyoushouldknowpodcast**Social Media***Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/879254746173653Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thing.syoushouldknow/**Fitness, Yoga and Mindfulness**Alo Moves: https://www.talkable.com/x/rSpBAv**Free 30 day trial / Yoga, Mindfulness and Meditation-----------------------------------------------------------WAYS TO CREATE ADDITIONAL REVENUETOP 3 OFFERS1 - https://c476dlqztiy6vh147kdz0y5m41.hop.clickbank.net/?cbpage=dirsp12 - https://7c81ffn0ja22uga1lqm33ma1jt.hop.clickbank.net/3 - https://797acut2siy6wj81r2xauxe39j.hop.clickbank.net/-------------------------------------------------------------What is the metaverse?Good question. â€œMetaverseâ€ is currently a major buzzword in the worlds of tech, business, and finance, and like all buzzwords its definition is fuzzy, contested, and shaped by the ambitions of the people using it.Hereâ€™s one thing we can say for sure: The term was coined by Neal Stephenson in his 1992 novel Snow Crash to describe a virtual world in wide use in his imagined future, a 21st-century dystopia. In Snow Crash, the metaverse is a virtual-reality world depicted as a planet-encircling market where virtual real estate can be bought and sold, and where VR goggle-wearing users inhabit 3D avatars whose form they have freedom to choose.These three elements â€” a VR interface, digital ownership, and avatars â€” still feature prominently in current conceptions of the metaverse. But none of them is actually essential to the idea. In the broadest terms, the metaverse is understood as a graphically rich virtual space, with some degree of verisimilitude, where people can work, play, shop, socialize â€” in short, do the things humans like to do together in real life (or, perhaps more to the point, on the internet). Metaverse proponents often focus on the concept of â€œpresenceâ€ as a defining factor: feeling like youâ€™re really there, and feeling like other people are really there with you, too.This version of the metaverse arguably already exists in the form of video games. But thereâ€™s another definition of the metaverse that goes beyond the virtual worlds we know. This definition doesnâ€™t actually describe the metaverse at all, but does explain why everyone thinks Support the Podcast:Â  https://www.buzzsprout.com/1590358/support Closing of ReThinkBuzzsprout - Let's get your podcast launched!Â Start for FREEBuzzsprout - Let's get your podcast launched! title: Are video calls the best we can do in the age of the metaverse? | Josephine Eyre
description: Remote work, while redefining the workplace landscape, seems stuck behind endless video conference calls that hinder free-flowing conversation and collaboration. In the 21st century, is that really the best we can do? Digital anthropologist Josephine Eyre makes the case for embracing the metaverse as an immersive meeting place that could help reignite creativity and communication. After the talk, TED Tech host Sherrell Dorsey shares thoughts on the future of big tech in the workplace. If you'd like to hear more ideas on how tech is transforming humanity, follow TED Tech wherever you're listening to this.

title: Why the Metaverse Buzz Is Cooling
description: P.M. Edition for March 29. There was a lot of enthusiasm around the metaverse when Facebook rebranded itself to become Meta in 2021. But lately, companies are souring on the idea. title: Metaverse & Beyond: Simerjeet Singh and Dan Nieves on the Future of Work
description: Discover the transformative potential of the Future of Work with two esteemed experts - Keynote Speaker on Future of Work, Simerjeet Singh, and Global Metaverse Solutions Lead, Dan Nieves, as they engage in a thought-provoking conversation on Meta's Workplace platform. This insightful discussion is part of a remarkable initiative by Workplace from Meta, bringing together the brightest minds to share their knowledge and predictions about the evolving landscape of work. Simerjeet Singh, a globally recognized Future of Work Expert and Specialist, has inspired countless organizations through his captivating speeches and interactive workshops. Recently featured among the Top Most Influential Thought Leaders to Follow in 2023 by Education View Magazine, Simerjeet is known for igniting creativity and driving innovation across various industries. As part of his Beginner's Mind series, Simerjeet has interviewed renowned Future of Work Speakers such as Professor Peter Cappelli, Mr. Bhushan Sethi, Jeremy Scrivens, and Shawn Kanungo. In this exclusive virtual interaction, Simerjeet Singh and Dan Nieves delve deep into the world of the Metaverse and the Future of Work, providing valuable insights on developing a growth mindset, refining the employee experience, and embracing change through agility, curiosity, and experimentation. Learn how to lead teams with confidence and clarity in an ever-evolving landscape and ensure your organization is set up for success. Meta's Workplace is a popular platform designed to enhance internal communication, employee engagement, and foster effective partnerships within companies. Accessible on both mobile and PC, Workplace is a user-friendly solution that addresses essential business communication needs and strengthens company culture. Stay ahead in the dynamic world of work by gaining access to cutting-edge insights and research from Simerjeet Singh and other Future of Work Specialists. Don't miss this incredible opportunity to learn from the best and join hundreds of businesses that have already benefited from Simerjeet's expertise. Watch it on YouTube: https://youtu.be/6FTdOE3_q2c #FutureOfWork #Metaverse #SimerjeetSingh #DigitalTransformation #Innovation #Leadership #GrowthMindset #WorkplaceFromMeta  Follow us on: https://linktr.ee/SimerjeetSingh

title: The Metaverse and the Embodied Machine
description: In this and the next episode I talk about how technological convergence drives the metaverse, the pursuit of virtual embodiment and how Lyotard might think of the metaverse. The texts this week are Lyotard's "Can Thoughts Go Without a Body." Also, Mark Zuckerberg's interview with The Verge is worth a look. During the recording my mic quit, so the last 10m or so were automatically recorded by my laptop mic. The audio is still serviceable, and a salutary lesson to check your sound source when you go back recording after finishing lunch!  These lectures are brought to you by Staffordshire University's Philosophy team. Come study on our MA in Continental Philosophy via thisÂ link. Or, join our MA in Philosophy of Nature, Information and Technology via thisÂ link. Find out more about meÂ here. January and September intakes available either F/T or P/T.

title: The Body is the Metaverse
description: Science fiction writers and tech enthusiasts have long spoken of a digital Metaverse â€” a virtual otherworld that, as the narrative goes, is the logical next phase in human technological development. This Metaverse serves a deep mythosomatic function â€” it satisfies our collective need for otherworlds, for trance, for mythic narrative, for journeying, and even for shapeshifting. Yet it does so removed from all somatic context â€” without the accompanying ritual, without any somatic sacrifice, without the sweat of the dance or the fast or the vision quest and without providing any larger contextual purpose or individual/cultural renewal. The brokers of the new digital Metaverse seek to sell us a shamanic otherworld, while traditional access to such otherworlds takes place through the simplest of all vehicles â€” the body. Traditional trance practices harness breath, movement, vocal invocation, and artistic visioning as portals to otherworlds, whose ultimate purpose is not escape, entertainment, or distraction but to re-invigorate our relationship with this world. And so the magisters of tech veer into what, according to the myths and fairy tales, is profoundly dangerous territory â€” misusing the power of the otherworld, harnessing mass trance-induction techniques for profit rather than for communal transformation and renewal. Tech dystopias, shapeshifters, plant beings, Tantric meta-anatomies, fairy woods and more... on this episode of The Emerald.Support the show

title: AI, Whole Brain Emulation & The Future We Canâ€™t Ignore, with Lawrence Lundy of Lunar Ventures
description: In todayâ€™s episode of The Metaverse Podcast, Lawrence Lundy joins host Jamie to explore the frontier of cutting-edge technologies, including large language models, neuroscience, and decentralized networks. Â  If youâ€™re fascinated about AI, emerging technologies, data privacy, investment prospects, and the intriguing notion of brain emulation, this podcast offers a thought-provoking journey through the world of pioneering technologies. Tune in to: Dive into large language models, neuroscience, and decentralized networks and explore the potential of these innovations to reshape industries and societies. Gain valuable insights into the practical applications of large language models, like AI-generated content creation, and how theyâ€™re driving significant changes across various sectors, including media and entertainment. Gain a compelling perspective on how privacy-enhancing technologies could reshape the way we handle data and unlock associated investment opportunities. Venture into futuristic ideas, such as whole brain emulation, which could fundamentally change our understanding of human consciousness and artificial intelligence. Discover the latest advancements in silicon and hardware innovations that are crucial for AI and crypto technologies, including robot chiplets, high-bandwidth memory, optical computing, analog computing, and quantum computing. Gain insights into the current state of decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) and how they are evolving with the integration of massive trained models.  #ai #wholebrainemulation #technology #vc ------------ Â  Whether youâ€™re a founder, investor, developer, or just have an interest in the future of the Open Metaverse, we invite you to hear from the people supporting its growth. title: An Inhuman Metaverse
description: On this episode, I conclude my discussion about the metaverse with a reflection on Lyotard's philosophy. While Lyotard died in 1998 his prognostications about technology, capital, economics are searingly insightful and relevant. Lyotard suggests perhaps our best chance for emancipating ourselves from the dangerous dispositions of our tools is to embrace an aesthetic confrontation with the technosphere. This means we need to figure out how to embed contingency, creation, dialogue and humanity into our machines then we have some hope of saving ourselves, at least before our sun goes supernova! In this episode I also had a think about Matthew Bell's very thought-provoking essay "The Metaverse: What It Is, Where to Find it, and Who Will Build It" which is available via his website. Also, I referenced the art exhibition Les ImmatÃ©riaux which was curated by Lyotard.  These lectures are brought to you by Staffordshire University's Philosophy team. Come study on our MA in Continental Philosophy via thisÂ link. Or, join our MA in Philosophy of Nature, Information and Technology via thisÂ link. Find out more about meÂ here. January and September intakes available either F/T or P/T.

title: The Metaverse, Crypto, Virtual Society
description: This episode is a deep dive on all things metaverse, defining what the metaverse is, and what it isnâ€™t; covering frequent misconceptions (and nuances) around how VR or virtual reality, videogames, and other applications relate (and don't relate) to the metaverse; and discussing how communities, fashion, sports, and more play here. Â We also go into where crypto comes in -- including discussing trends in on-chain gaming, DAOs; themes like interoperability, composability; etc. Â But we also go well beyond technology -- and into science fiction, the arts, low-fidelity design, narrative, and much, much more -- in this wide-ranging, hallway-style conversation between:Herman Narula, author of the new book Virtual Society: The Metaverse and the New Frontiers of Human Experience; Narula is also the CEO and co-founder of Improbable;Elena Burger, deal partner on a16z crypto (where she focuses on games, NFTs, web3 media, infrastructure, and more); Berger also wrote a thoughtful review of Narulaâ€™s book;...and host Sonal Chokshi (who also shares writings on topics such as "narrative collapse" and more as well as past episodes of the a16z Podcast with Narula on distributed systems at scale, gaming, and more).For more on metaverse from the a16z crypto, please see this piece.To order Narula's book, please select from here.---web3 with a16z is a show about building the next generation of the internet, fromÂ the team at a16z crypto. As a reminder, none of the content isÂ investment, business,Â legal,Â or tax advice; please see a16z.com/disclosures for more important information, including a link to a list of our investments.

title: Breaking Down the Meta Connect 2023 Announcements + Epic Games Announce Major Layoffs
description: The tagline for this episode is 'Return of the Zuck' - we recently saw some major announcements from Meta Connect 2023 that are genuinely quite game changing for the future of the metaverse. We break them down and what they mean for the next few months.  Plus we saw Epic Games announce it is laying off 16% of its workforce just before Unreal Fest. What does this mean for their focus on the future of Fortnite, UEFN and the Epic Games ecosystem?   We also talk about the next phase of AI capable of multimodality, what that means and the challenges that lie ahead. title: Dr Douglas Haugen - Exclusive Preview of 'In Pursuit of the Metaverse'
description: Dr Douglas Haugen gives an exclusive preview from his forthcoming book, 'In Pursuit of the Metaverse: Millennial Dreams, Political Religion, and Techno-Utopia'.  In this excerpt from Chapters 9 and 10 of his book, Dr Haugen explores the Spirit of Gnosticism, the Demonic in Politics, and Puritan Sorcery. Dr Haugen looks at these threads within the frame of political religion. He reflects on the weighty issues of religious and political authority, and the attempted absolutising of the imminent frame by the seed of the serpent through history.  Dr Haugen is host of the Dr Deep State channel which can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/@dr.deepstate5867/videos  Dr Haugen's book 'Seeing through the Singularity: Uncovering the Cosmic Conspiracy' is available here: https://www.amazon.com/Seeing-Through-Singularity-Uncovering-Conspiracy/dp/1657125181/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=seeing+through+the+singularity&qid=1678717131&sr=8-1  Modest donations are gratefully accepted to support my research costs, enable a higher frequency of broadcasts and improve production values:  https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=5Y9AE7F4SHHA4

title: Metaverse : qu'est-ce que The Sandbox ?
description: Depuis le temps que l'on vous en parle dans ce podcast, vous commencez Ã  connaÃ®tre un petit peu ce qu'est le Metaverse et ce qu'il reprÃ©sente pour les gÃ©ants de la Tech. ConcrÃ¨tement, il s'agit d'une dÃ©clinaison virtuelle de notre monde, quelque peu amÃ©liorÃ©, c'est en tout cas l'ambition du projet, et pour lequel les GAFAM ont un intÃ©rÃªt trÃ¨s prononcÃ©. Pour certains observateurs, il s'agirait mÃªme de l'avenir de l'humanitÃ© faÃ§on Matrix ou Ready Player One. Et parmi les nombreux acteurs qui travaillent sur ce Metaverse, on retrouve The Sandbox, une plateforme franÃ§aise qui compte dÃ©jÃ  plus de 2 millions d'utilisateurs. De quoi s'agit-il ? Pourquoi rencontre-t-elle un tel succÃ¨s ? C'est ce que je vous propose de voir dans cet Ã©pisode. Pour vous faire une idÃ©e, The Sandbox (littÃ©ralement le bac Ã  sable en franÃ§ais), figure dans le top 3 des mondes virtuels les plus populaires surr la planÃ¨te avec plus de deux millions d'utilisateurs actifs. Mais avant de connaÃ®tre un succÃ¨s mondial, ce metaverse est avant tout un succÃ¨s franÃ§ais qui ne date pas d'hier. En rÃ©alitÃ©, The Sandbox a Ã©tÃ© crÃ©Ã© par SÃ©bastien Borget et Arthur Madrid en 2011 avec un principe simple : chaque joueur pouvait crÃ©er son propre univers 2D, avec hÃ©ros et ennemis, le tout sur de multiples niveaux. Si l'idÃ©e de base reste la mÃªme qu'il y a 11 ans, l'expÃ©rience a quelque peu Ã©voluÃ© depuis, car The Sandbox est devenu un acteur majeur du metaverse. Plus qu'un simple outil, la plateforme reprÃ©sente dÃ©sormais un business a part entiÃ¨re pour de nombreuses entreprises, comme les Groupe Casino et Carrefour qui y ont dÃ©jÃ  achetÃ© des terrains virtuels pour expÃ©rimenter et anticiper les Ã©volutions des futurs modes de consommation. D'ailleurs, certains observateurs Ã©voquent mÃªme l'ouverture de supermarchÃ©s virtuels avec des ventes de produits certifiÃ©s sous forme de NFT. Autre grande entreprise a avoir misÃ© sur The Sandbox, Warner Music Group qui a annoncÃ© il y a peu la crÃ©ation d'un parc d'attraction musical virtuel via la plateforme. Ubisoft, Square Enix, mais aussi Gucci et Adidas ont Ã©galement achetÃ© des terrains virtuels pour y proposer Ã  l'avenir de nouvelles expÃ©riences. Au total, prÃ¨s de 200 marques ont dÃ©jÃ  investies dans The Sandbox avec l'ambition d'interagir davantage avec leurs clients et proposer de nouvelles expÃ©riences. Sur prÃ¨s de 166 000 parcelles disponibles dans ce metaverse franÃ§ais, prÃ¨s de 20 000 ont dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© vendues, dont une sur cinq appartient Ã  une entreprise. Mais finalement, pourquoi les entreprises se ruent-elles sur les terrains proposÃ©s par The Sandbox ? D'aprÃ¨s un employÃ© d'Adidas que je cite Â« cela permettra de crÃ©er de nouvelle opportunitÃ©s pour partenariats, plus d'engagement Ã  travers les biens numÃ©riques et un chemin vers un avenir plus inclusif Â» fin de citation. Un constat partagÃ© comme vous avez pu le constater par de nombreuses marques, et qui fait de The Sandbox un nouvel outil marketing sur lequel elles comptent beaucoup miser Ã  l'avenir. title: How to Market Inside the Metaverse #2592
description: In episode #2592, we discuss the concept of the Metaverse and its potential impact on marketing. We reference an interview between Lex Friedman and Mark Zuckerberg, where they discuss the possibility of conducting interviews in the Metaverse. We express our skepticism about the Metaverse as a social network but see potential in its applications for virtual reality and augmented reality.Â We discuss scenarios such as virtual family gatherings and virtual car shopping. We also compare the hardware capabilities of Facebook's Oculus with Apple's rumored VR/AR device, expressing our belief that Apple's hardware will be superior. Overall, we agree that the Metaverse, in whatever form it takes, will have a significant impact on advertising and marketing. title: Are We Lining Up for the Next Bull Market Cycle? | Meta Quest 3 Release, RTFKT x Nike Make Waves, Unreal Fest & A World Record in VR
description: Now that we've had the layoffs, SBF's trial and major corrections across the board...we know what happens next. Are we beginning to see crypto and metaverse sentiments gradually turn positive again?  This week Luke and Robin take a sense check of the space as a whole, assess what has survived and what is beginning to thrive once more.   In this episode we talk about :  - The cyclical nature of the crypto and tech markets - The Meta Quest 3 getting in the hands of everyday people and mixed reality making a lot of sense - The NFT projects that survived (RTFKT and Nike releasing sort after sneakers) - The Ryder Ripps / BAYC case coming to a close and what the future looks like for Yuga Labs  - Unreal Fest and where Epic Games' focus is for the next few months - Robin's wild Guinness World Record spending the longest time playing a game in VR  Luke's Twitter/X : â â â â https://twitter.com/luke_franksâ â â â  Robin's Twitter/X : â â â â https://twitter.com/IamSuperMassiveâ â â â   For speaker/appearance/advisory bookings - please pop a message to lukeelliotfranks@gmail.com

title: Future Tech: The Metaverse
description: Itâ€™s a buzzy word meant to invoke a sense of immersion within a virtual world â€” where boundaries are obliterated, and possibilities are limitless. But what will the Metaverse actually feel like? From the holographic visions of tech companies, to the hardware required to make it happen, to the revolutionary potential of mind uploading and mixed reality, will a fully cyber society make life easier â€” or end life as we know it? title: S21:E5 - What is the Metaverse and what does it look like to build for it
description: In this episode, we talk about what is the Metaverse and what does it look like to build for it with Daniel Liebeskind, co-founder and CEO of Topia. Daniel talks about what goes into building something for the web3 space like Topia, where the line between something being a part of the Metaverse and not being a part of the Metaverse is, and what the future of the Metaverse might looks like.

title: 402 | Jonathan Taplin: Reality vs. Dystopia - The Fantasy Future of the Metaverse, Mars, & Crypto
description: Subscribe to The Realignment to access our exclusive Q&A episodes and support the show: https://realignment.supercast.com/REALIGNMENT NEWSLETTER: https://therealignment.substack.com/PURCHASE BOOKS AT OUR BOOKSHOP: https://bookshop.org/shop/therealignmentEmail Us: realignmentpod@gmail.comFoundation for American Innovation: https://www.thefai.org/posts/lincoln-becomes-faiJonathan Taplin, author of The End of Reality: How Four Billionaires Are Selling a Fantasy Future of the Metaverse, Mars, and Crypto and The Magic Years: Scenes from a Rock-and-Roll Life, joins The Realignment. Marshall and discuss and debate whether the Metaverse, Crypto, and the mission to Mars are worthy projects, how politics is downstream from culture and technology, and his time managing Bob Dylan's tours in the 60s, producing with Martin Scorsese in the 70s, and work on Wall Street and the tech industry during the 80s and 90s.Â

title: Bilawal Sidhu, A Mind Living At the Intersection of Bits & Atoms
description: Bilawal Sidhu joins the podcast to discuss his background in emerging tech and experiences working at Google. Sidhu became interested in mixed realities at a young age when he saw visual effects being used to blend the physical and digital worlds in movies. This inspired him to learn 3D animation and visual effects software. Â Â Later, Sidhu studied computer science and business at USC while continuing to flex his creative muscles. At Google, he worked on VR media, digital twins like Google Earth, and consumer products like Immersive View in Google Maps. Â Â Sidhu shares lessons on embracing new platforms as a creator and finding viral content market fit. He recommends creators use AI to augment their skills rather than replace them. On ethical AI, he suggests regulating different models differently instead of blanket policies. Â Â For mainstream AR/VR adoption, Sidhu points to the need for more headset install base. He's excited about spatial computing enhanced by natural language interactions courtesy of generative AI. Sidhu wants an all-in-one creative tool combining video, 3D and collaboration. He shouts out colleagues who supported his vision and his parents who enabled his creative pursuits.Â Â ====Â Have any comments or questions? Email the show Feedback@Buildingtheopenmetaverse.orgÂ Â Â Want more information? Visit our website www.buildingtheopenmetaverse.orgÂ Â Â And make sure you follow us on Linkedin for all of our show updates Â Â https://www.linkedin.com/company/buildingtheopenmetaverse/Â Building the Open Metaverse is a podcast hosted by Patrick Cozzi (Cesium) and Marc Petit (Epic Games) that invites a broad range of technical experts to share their insights on how the community is building the metaverse together.Â #BuildingTheOpenMetaversePodcast #MetaversePodcast #Metaverse

title: "Snow Crashing Into The Metaverse" from Imaginary Worlds
description: This week, weâ€™re sharing an episode of Imaginary Worlds. For the last 30 years, the real world has been catching up to Neal Stephensonâ€™s vision of the future in his 1992 novel Snow Crash, which influenced the creators of Google Earth, Second Life, Oculus Rift and more. Now the centerpiece of the novel, a virtual world called The Metaverse, may become a daily part of our lives thanks to Facebook (renamed Meta) and other big tech companies. In this episode of Imaginary Worlds, host Eric Molinsky explores whether itâ€™s a good idea to use a satirical cyberpunk novel from decades ago as a blueprint for the future.You can hear more episodes of Imaginary Worlds at https://www.imaginaryworldspodcast.orgSee omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

title: Episode 38: Wird uns das Metaversum alle verschlucken?
description: Es ist eines der momentan am meisten gehypten Themen: das Metaverse. Milliarden Dollar werden in diese Technologie bereits investiert. Dabei weiÃŸ niemand genau, was das Metaverse eigentlich ist und wie es einmal aussehen wird. Ist dieser Hype also gerechtfertigt? Und droht nicht vielleicht sogar die Gefahr, dass diese neue Parallelwelt uns User aufsaugt und aus ihrem Bann nicht mehr entlÃ¤sst?

title: Tech and AI: 3. VR, AR and the Metaverse
description: Just by putting on a headset, Virtual Reality promises to immerse you in another world, and Augmented Reality takes that world and brings it into your living room. How do they work? It's a type of technology that seems to have been "the next big thing" for at least a decade. But are they just expensive toys, or do they have a use beyond gaming?   In a similar vein, you may have seen adverts for the Metaverse, and that Facebook's parent company is pumping huge amounts of money into it. But what is it? How are Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality linked to the Metaverse, and will they make it...a reality?    Technology has already completely altered our lives, and Artificial Intelligence may transform our world to an even greater degree. This series is your chance to get back to basics and really understand key technology terms. What's an algorithm? How does Broadband work and what exactly is Blockchain? What's the difference between machine and deep learning in artificial intelligence, and is it just our jobs under threat, or is it much worse than that? And before we get to the destruction of humanity, should we all be using Bitcoin? Our experts will explain in the very simplest terms everything you need to know about the tech that underpins your day. We'll explore the rich history of how all these systems developed, and where they may be going next.  Presenter: Spencer Kelly Producers: Ravi Naik and Nick Holland  Editor: Clare Fordham Production Coordinator: Janet Staples

title: An Update on The Metaverse
description: What's the state of the metaverse? In late 2021, dozens of companies started to push hard to become players in creating the metaverse. But how many stuck with it? Has any progress been made? And who the heck wants this to be a thing?See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

title: Business and the Metaverse
description: How should business approach the metaverse? The metaverse is going to be a world in which we will live, but live differently from what we are doing today.Â  Meta means beyond and verse is a play on universe. So it's a world beyond the current world. In this episode of Global Truths, Dr Keith Suter considers what the world will look like when the Metaverse becomes part of our daily lives - and what the business community will need to do to prepare for the new tomorrow.Â Â See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

title: Web3 Strategies for Security and Community Engagement, with Andrew Ciaccia of Interlock
description: In today's episode of The Metaverse Podcast, we chat with Andrew Ciaccia of Interlock, a company focused on blockchain-based security solutions and threat intelligence for DeFi. Andrew joins host Jamie Burke to discuss the untold challenges and strategies for launching and scaling a Web3 startup. If you're a Web3 founder, community builder, or simply into DeFi, this episode is a must-listen. You'll: Learn ways to fend off phishing and social engineering threats in Web3 to better protect your assets. Find out how rewarding everyday users can boost your cybersecurity and threat awareness in a Web3 environment. Understand the critical role of strategic messaging and goal alignment for a successful Web3 startup launch. Gain key insights into the unique challenges and opportunities of community-building when moving from Web2 to Web3. Discover how transparency and public interaction in Web3 can both strengthen and challenge your community.         #cybersecurity #blockchain #web3community #ai #defi        ------------ Â  Whether youâ€™re a founder, investor, developer, or just have an interest in the future of the Open Metaverse, we invite you to hear from the people supporting its growth. Outlier Ventures is the Open Metaverse accelerator, helping over 100 Web3 startups a year. You can apply for startup funding here - https://ov.click/pddsbcq122 Questions? Join our community: Twitter - https://ov.click/pddssotwq122 LinkedIn - https://ov.click/pddssoliq122 Discord - https://ov.click/pddssodcq122 Telegram - https://ov.click/pddssotgq122 More - https://ov.click/pddslkq122 For further Open Metaverse content: Listen to The Metaverse Podcast - https://ov.click/pddsmcq122 Sign up for our quarterly live events at - https://ov.click/pddsdfq122 Check out our portfolio - https://ov.click/pddspfq122 Thanks for listening!

title: What Business Leaders Should Know Now About the Metaverse
description: It might still seem like a buzzword, or something that only matters to tech CEOs. But Matthew Ball, CEO of Epyllion and the former global head of strategy for Amazon Studios, says the metaverse is the "new internet" â€“ and that it's already here. He argues that companies large and small need to not only better understand what the metaverse is, but should also be developing strategies around it today. That can have an impact on marketing, customer relations, product development, and much more, he says. Ball is the author of "The Metaverse: And How it Will Revolutionize Everything."

title: Ep - 20 | Metaverse Gamification Explained | Telugu Technology Podcast | AR&VR | Telugu Business Podcast | Raw Talks With Vamshi Kurapati
description: In this captivating episode of the #RawTalks Telugu Podcast, we delve into the fascinating realms of augmented and virtual realities, exploring a world beyond our imagination. Join us as we unravel the mysteries of these cutting-edge technologies, pushing the boundaries of what we perceive as real.  Unlock the secrets of fungible and non-fungible products, as we navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital assets. Discover the profound impact they have on industries and individuals alike, revolutionizing the way we buy, sell, and interact with virtual goods.  Step into the metaverse, a boundless virtual universe that promises endless possibilities. We explore its vast potential, envisioning a future where people can connect, collaborate, and create in immersive digital environments. Brace yourself for the visionary insights of our special guest, Mr. Jignesh, Co-founder of Perspect AI, who will leave you spellbound with his expertise.  T-Hub, a prominent innovation hub, becomes our gateway to funding and support for groundbreaking ventures. Learn how this dynamic ecosystem fosters entrepreneurship and propels innovative ideas into reality. Discover the incredible opportunities that await passionate individuals and startups in this thriving ecosystem. We also delve into the realm of experimental learning through gaming, where education meets entertainment. Uncover the power of gamification as a tool for immersive and engaging learning experiences, transcending traditional methods and capturing the imagination of learners of all ages.  Prepare yourself for a thought-provoking journey that challenges your perception of reality. Join us on Spotify and immerse yourself in this extraordinary episode of #RawTalks Telugu Podcast, where innovation, technology, and imagination collide. title: Meta : un metaverse trop buggÃ© mÃªme pour les dÃ©veloppeurs ?
description: Le Metaverse, voilÃ  un concept, que dis-je une sorte dâ€™utopie dont on parle pratiquement toutes les semaines dans ce podcast tant lâ€™actualitÃ© qui lâ€™entoure est riche. Et si je parle dâ€™utopie, câ€™est parce que dans notre imaginaire, on associe le metaverse Ã  une copie de notre monde virtuel comme imaginÃ© dans Matrix ou Ready Player One. Or, la rÃ©alitÃ© Ã  ce jour est tout autre. Dâ€™aprÃ¨s Vishal Shah, dirigeant du metaverse chez Meta, nouveau nom du groupe Facebook, la plateforme Horizon Worlds serait remplie de bugs rendant lâ€™expÃ©rience dÃ©plaisante, Ã  tel point que mÃªme les Ã©quipes travaillant sur son dÃ©veloppement nâ€™auraient pas envie de lâ€™utiliser.Â  En changeant de nom pour Meta, le groupe Facebook a dÃ©cidÃ© de mettre le Metaverse au cÅ“ur de ses prioritÃ©s. Ce metaverse a aujourdâ€™hui un nomÂ : Horizon Worlds, monde virtuel dans lequel les gens se dÃ©placent grÃ¢ce Ã  des avatars, exactement comme dans un jeu vidÃ©o. Cet espace virtuel est disponible via le casque Meta Quest 2 (anciennement Oculus Quest) depuis dÃ©cembre 2021, et mÃªme en France depuis peu. Ceci dit, la plateforme serait encore loin dâ€™Ãªtre parfaite. Dans une note interne consultÃ©e par le site spÃ©cialisÃ© The Verge, Vishal Shah dirigeant du metaverse chez Meta, dÃ©plore je cite Â« les retours actuels de nos crÃ©ateurs, utilisateurs, testeurs et de nombreux membres de l'Ã©quipe [Ces derniers pointent du doigt] le poids cumulÃ© des coupures, des problÃ¨mes de stabilitÃ© et des bugs, [ce qui rendrait] trop difficile pour notre communautÃ© l'expÃ©rience de la magie d'Horizon Â» fin de citation. Le dirigeant regrette que ses Ã©quipes travaillant sur le metaverse ne passent pas plus de temps sur la plateforme, Ã  tel point que la direction rÃ©flÃ©chit Ã  une maniÃ¨re de les y forcer. Ã€ ce jour, force est de constater quâ€™Horizon Worlds reste loin derriÃ¨re des rivaux comme FortniteÂ par exemple. En effet, le jeu est en quelque sorte un metaverse, avec lâ€™organisation dâ€™Ã©vÃ©nements de grande envergure comme des concerts virtuels ou mÃªme des films immersifs par exemple, lors de lâ€™annonce de ses nouveaux chapitres et Ã©vÃ©nements. Ã€ noter que lâ€™arrivÃ©e dâ€™Horizon Worlds en Europe avait Ã©tÃ© sacrÃ©ment moquÃ©e pour des graphismes peu flatteurs, ce qui a poussÃ© Mark Zuckerberg Ã  annoncer des mises Ã  jour majeures qui devraient avoir lieu cette semaine lors de la confÃ©rence annuelle Connect, ce 11 octobre. Le groupe Meta devrait aussi profiter de lâ€™Ã©vÃ©nement pour prÃ©senter son nouveau casque VR haut de gamme. Sachant que le metaverse est la pierre angulaire du futur de Meta avec des milliards de dollars investis dans son dÃ©veloppement, on peut sâ€™attendre Ã  une rÃ©action assez virulente de la part du groupe. Jâ€™entends par lÃ  dans changements forts dans son approche du metaverse et du contenu dâ€™Horizon Worlds dans le but de faire taire les critiques.Â Une dÃ©marche qui pourrait durer jusquâ€™Ã  la fin de lâ€™annÃ©e dâ€™aprÃ¨s Vishal Shah. title: Chatterbox #300 â€“ The metaverse
description: Is the metaverse our future reality or just a dystopian fantasy? In this episode, Andrew and Anna talk all about virtual reality and share their opinions on how they see the future of the metaverse.  Chatterbox is a Culips series designed for intermediate and advanced English learners. This series features native speakers having natural conversations about fascinating topics that help you improve your English listening and speaking skills. Plus, you might learn something interesting along the way!          Fun facts You might think that the concept of the metaverse is recent, but did you know that the idea of virtual reality, or VR, dates all the way back to 1838? Thatâ€™s when the VR headset of the 19th centuryâ€”the stereoscopeâ€”was invented by an English scientist, Charles Wheatstone. title: What's in Store for the Metaverse?
description: The future of technology was supposed to be the metaverseâ€”a massive virtual world that mimics real life. A world where augmented reality and virtual reality converge.   But the initial hoopla has given way to disenchantment. Companies that had lofty ambitions for the metaverse are now scrambling away from it. Which begs the question: what is next for the metaverse? Tune in to the latest episode of TechTonic Shift to find out!

title: 754. Learning & Teaching English in The Metaverse / The Mandalorian (with Andy Johnson)
description: 754. Learning & Teaching English in The Metaverse / The Mandalorian (with Andy Johnson) Andy Johnson returns to talk about more â€œMâ€ words - this time itâ€™s The Metaverse and The Mandalorian. The Metaverse is an immersive and interactive 3D online environment. How can it be used for learning and teaching English? Andyâ€™s new job is with a company that offers English learning in the metaverse, so letâ€™s chat about it. Also, we finally talk about The Mandalorian on LEP after waiting nearly a year! This is probably the last episode of LEP in 2021 - so Merry Christmas everyone and I hope you have a Happy New Year! title: Real World Assets (RWAs) as The Road to Mass Adoption in DeFi, with Helix & Open Trade
description: In today's episode of The Metaverse Podcast, Jamie is joined by two exceptional founders, both portfolio companies, to delve into the realm of Real World Assets (RWAs):  Jitendra Jaitawat of Helix, an accredited marketplace using blockchain technology to provide access to off-chain private credit in emerging markets.   Dave Sutter of Open Trade, providing treasurers, fintechs, and institutions access to on-chain structured financial products backed by investment grade financial assets.   If you're a Web3 founder, investor, or DeFi enthusiast, this episode is essential listening. You will:  Explore the evolution and challenges of scaling in the crypto and RWA industry, focusing on advancements in technology and regulatory clarity.   Learn about the complex layers of the RWA ecosystem, concentrating on standards, infrastructure, and asset specialization, and how these elements interface with regulations to propel the industry.   Understand the modernized methods replacing traditional practices in managing counterparty risk, with a spotlight on progress in interoperability, legal alignment, and identity verification.   Gain insights into diverse go-to-market strategies for achieving product-market fit in the DeFi sector, with particular focus on balancing supply and demand for liquidity and yield products.   Find out what's still missing to scale asset classes in the crypto space, dissecting the technical, regulatory, and financial barriers that lie ahead.   #RWAs #RealWorldAssets #defi #cryptoregulation ------------ Â  Whether youâ€™re a founder, investor, developer, or just have an interest in the future of the Open Metaverse, we invite you to hear from the people supporting its growth. Outlier Ventures is the Open Metaverse accelerator, helping over 100 Web3 startups a year. You can apply for startup funding here - https://ov.click/pddsbcq122 Questions? Toujours d'aprÃ¨s le groupe, un algorithme d'apprentissage automatique sera capable de digÃ©rer des sets de donnÃ©es de lâ€™ordre de lâ€™exaoctet, ce qui reprÃ©sente environ 36 000 annÃ©es de vidÃ©o haute dÃ©finition. C'en est presque ridicule tant c'est tout simplement immense. En guise d'application concrÃ¨te, Meta parle de traductions vocales en temps rÃ©el ou encore des possibilitÃ©s de jeu en rÃ©seau en rÃ©alitÃ© augmentÃ©e. Concernant le metaverse, les capacitÃ©s de calcul de RCS devraient aider Meta Ã  crÃ©er je cite Â« les technologies fondamentales qui feront fonctionner son univers virtuel Â». title: #608: Signal Over Noise with Noah Feldman â€” The War in Ukraine (Recap and Predictions), The Machiavelli of Maryland, Best Books to Understand Geopolitics, The Battles for Free Speech on Social Media, Metaverse Challenges, and More
description: Tim Ferriss and Noah Feldman on The War in Ukraine (Recap and Predictions), The Machiavelli of Maryland, Best Books to Understand Geopolitics, The Battles for Free Speech on Social Media, Metaverse Challenges, and More | Brought to you by MANSCAPED premium grooming products, Athletic GreensÂ all-in-one nutritional supplement, and AllformÂ premium, modular furniture. More on all three below. I rarely cover current events on this podcast, but this is a new experiment.To avoid overwhelm, I do not track the news 24/7 with doom scrolling. Rather, I depend on conversations with my smartest friends to find the signal in the noise. The following conversation withÂ Noah FeldmanÂ (@NoahRFeldman) is an example of such a conversation, very similar to what we would have offline, and I wanted to share it with you. I learned a ton and changed my thinking a lot, which I always do.Noah Feldman is a Harvard professor, ethical philosopher and advisor, public intellectual, religious scholar and historian, and author of 10 books, including his latest,Â The Broken Constitution: Lincoln, Slavery, and the Refounding of America. You can find my interview with him atÂ tim.blog/noah.Noah is the founder of Ethical Compass, which helps clients like Facebook and eBay improve ethical decision-making by creating and implementing new governance solutions. Noah conceived and designed the FacebookÂ Oversight BoardÂ and continues to advise Facebook on ethics and governance issues.Feldman is host of theÂ Deep BackgroundÂ podcast, a policy and public affairs columnist forÂ Bloomberg Opinion, and a former contributing writer forÂ The New York Times. He served as senior constitutional advisor to the Coalition Provisional Authority in Iraq and subsequently advised members of the Iraqi Governing Council on the drafting of Iraqâ€™s interim constitution.He earned his A.B. summa cum laude from Harvard, finishing first in his class. Selected as a Rhodes Scholar, he earned a DPhil from Oxford University, writing his dissertation on Aristotleâ€™s Ethics. He received his JD from Yale Law School and clerked for Justice David Souter of the US Supreme Court.He is the author of 10 books, includingÂ Divided by God: Americaâ€™s Church-State Problem â€” and What We Should Do About It;Â What We Owe Iraq: War and the Ethics of Nation Building;Â Cool War: The United States, China, and the Future of Global Competition;Â Scorpions: The Battles and Triumphs of FDRâ€™s Great Supreme Court Justices; andÂ The Three Lives of James Madison: Genius, Partisan, President.Please let me know what you think of this experimental format by sending me feedback on TwitterÂ @tferriss.Â Do you love it? Do you hate it? Have suggestions for improvement? The usual long-form interviews with evergreen questions will still be the default and bread and butter of this podcast, but if you like this, I could see doing more of them, perhaps once a month or once every two months. Itâ€™s just an easy way to get caught up without drowning in news.Please enjoy!NOTE: This episode was recorded on June 22nd.*This episode is brought to you by MANSCAPED! MANSCAPED is bringing you the total package to ensure your package is the perfect package. No, I didnâ€™t come up with that lineâ€¦ but I tested and loved their products, so I can vouch that Iâ€™m still intact and ready for my centerfold shoot. Was it scary? Yes. Was it worth it? Also yes. My girlfriend makes the effort, so I figured it was only fair. Use their precision-engineered Lawn Mower 4.0â€”yes, â€œLawn Mowerâ€â€”electric trimmer to remove excess and avoid the dreaded swamp crotch. I recommended it inÂ The 4-Hour BodyÂ in 2010 and did not get paid to do so. I do my best with nutrient-dense meals, of course, butÂ AGÂ further covers my bases with vitamins, minerals, and whole-food-sourced micronutrients that support gut health and the immune system.Â Right now,Â Athletic GreensÂ is offering you their Vitamin D Liquid Formula free with your first subscription purchaseâ€”a vital nutrient for a strong immune system and strong bones.Â VisitÂ AthleticGreens.com/TimÂ to claim this special offer today and receive the free Vitamin D Liquid Formula (and five free travel packs) with your first subscription purchase!Â Thatâ€™s up to a one-year supply of Vitamin D as added value when you try their delicious and comprehensive all-in-one daily greens product.*This episode is also brought to you byÂ Allform!Â If youâ€™ve been listening to the podcast for a while, youâ€™ve probably heard me talk about Helix Sleep mattresses, which Iâ€™ve been using since 2017. title: Matthew Ball on the Metaverse and Gaming
description: Fighting fires meant a lot of downtime for Matthew Ball. Stationed at a forward operating base in the woods for two weeks at a time, he spent long hours amongst fellow firefighters with whom he shared little in common except for their love of the outdoors. The skills he gained working towards mutual goals with those he had little else in common with has translated well to his career as a strategist and venture capitalist in the digital media and gaming industries. Ball is a managing partner of EpyllionCo, venture partner at Makers Fund, and author of the anticipated  The Metaverse: And How it Will Revolutionize Everything. Ball joined Tyler to discuss the eventual widespan transition of the population to the metaverse, the exciting implications of this interconnected network of 3D worlds for education, how the metaverse will improve dating and its impacts on sex, the happiness and career satisfaction of professional gamers, his predictions for Tylerâ€™s most frequent uses of the metaverse, his favorite type of entrepreneur, why he has thousands of tabs open on his computer at any given moment, and more. Read aÂ full transcript enhanced with helpful links. Recorded July 6th, 2022 Other ways to connect  Follow us onÂ TwitterÂ andÂ Instagram FollowÂ TylerÂ on TwitterÂ  Follow Matthew on Twitter Email us:Â cowenconvos@mercatus.gmu.edu Subscribe at our newsletter pageÂ to have the latest Conversations with Tyler news sent straight to your inbox.Â

title: E052 - Der Talk - Was ihr alles noch nicht von der Connect wusstet mit Christian Steiner, Unreal Fest, SteamVR 2.0 Beta und wer wird der neue Unity CEO?
description: Christian Steiner war auf der Meta Connect vor Ort und berichtet heute im Talk von Dingen, die wir im Livestream nicht mitbekommen haben. Zum Beispiel den Ausfall der Teleprompter. Eine ErklÃ¤rung fÃ¼r den seltsamen Auftritt Zuckerbergs. AuÃŸerdem gab es wohl Probleme bei der Einlasskontrolle, was dazu fÃ¼hrte, dass manche Besuchende die Keynote als Livestream vor dem GebÃ¤ude schauen mussten. Da hatte Christian GlÃ¼ck! Und auch wenn der Besuch einer Entwicklerkonferenz eines amerikanischen GroÃŸ-Konzerns immer ein Erlebnis ist, bringt Christian auch etwas Wehmut mit. Denn wie ein original Oculus-Event war die diesjÃ¤hrige Meta Connect nicht. Ãœberraschungsbestellung: Christian hat sich auch die Ray-Ban bestellt und er erklÃ¤rt ausfÃ¼hrlich warum.  Was sich mehr wie eine Developerkonferenz angefÃ¼hlt hat, war dann der Besuch des Unreal Fest. Christians Schilderungen zeigen, was bei der Community vor Ort vor allem fÃ¼r GesprÃ¤chsstoff sorgte: Die frei gehaltene Keynote Tim Sweeneys, der eine Ã„nderung im Preismodel der Unreal-Engine ankÃ¼ndigte. Vor dem Unreal Fest kÃ¼ndigte Sweeney bereits StellenkÃ¼rzungen an. Auf der Stage wiederholte der Epic-CEO aber das Commitment, dass egal was passiert, sie immer noch das oberste Ziel verfolgen, so etwas wie ein "Open Metaverse" zu bauen.  AuÃŸerdem in den News:  - SteamVR 2.0 Beta ist da, nach drei Jahren. - Unitys Preismodel-Apokalypse kostet nun den Kopf des CEOs. Wer wird die neue Nummer 1?

title: Metaverse: Marketing-Trick oder Revolution? / Talfahrt von Delivery Hero geht weiter

title: How to Prepare for the Metaverse
description: What is the metaverse? Where is it heading next? Businesses, consumers, finance and the public sector all stand to gain from the many opportunities and new approaches to engagement offered by the metaverse. First, early adopters should understand how to prepare and all thatâ€™s required to get started.Â  Â  In this episode, Tuong Nguyen, a Director Analyst with the Gartner Emerging Technologies and Trends team, who leads research on immersive technologies, metaverse, computer vision and more, speaks with Robert Hetu, a VP Analyst with the Gartner Retail Industry Services team, to relay answers to early metaverse questions around purpose, technology and expectations. title: Creating in a new world (Metaverse with Kourtin from Polygonal Mind)
description: The Metaverse is a whole new digital world with endless possibilities. It is very much still in development and that makes it the perfect time to become an early adapterâ€¦ and to even make some money playing! In this episode weâ€™re going to take a look at Decentraland. Decentraland is a digital world where you can own a plot of land and build whatever you want. The possibilities are endless and this calls for a lot of creativity and ingenuity. I invite 3D artist Kourtin from Polygonal Mind to the studio to tell me about their work helping companies like Doritos create incredible experiences in the Metaverse.Â

title: Robert Triefus on Leading Gucci Into the Metaverse
description: At The BoF Professional Summit: An Inflection Point in Fashion Tech, the seasoned luxury executive explained why Gucci believes in the long-term potential of fashion and web3.Â Â Background:Last September, Gucci announced that its CMO, Robert Triefus, would be taking on a new role as CEO of Â Gucci Vault and Metaverse Ventures. Now, he works closely with president and CEO, Marco Bizzarri, to shape Gucciâ€™s brand strategy while developing the houseâ€™s expansion into web3.Â This week on The BoF Podcast, Triefus sits down with BoFâ€™s Imran Amed to discuss how the luxury fashion houseâ€™s ambitions in virtual spaces fit with its wider business goals and brand repositioning.Â Â Â â€œIf we think about all that we're doing in the metaverse, we always have an eye on creativity, creating the emotion,â€ says Triefus. â€œBut underpinning that is the story of the brand and all that rich storytelling that has built up over 102 years.â€Â Key Insights:Triefus says itâ€™s particularly important for a luxury brand like Gucci to experiment with new technologies, because it offers a testing ground. â€œThrough [Gucci] Vault, we're able to push ourselves into places where for the core brand, it might be considered to be too risky. But through Vault, we have that playground space so that if by chance we were to make a mistake, we're not going to impact the core brand,â€ he says.Â Popping up in the metaverse plays a similar role for Gucci as running a billboard or other advertising activation. â€œIt's an opportunity to engage with the community that is going into Times Square in the real world,â€ says Triefus.Â Gucci Garden, which received 19 million visitors in two weeks and saw a digital version of its Dionysus bag retail for more than the cost of the physical bag, helped dictate steps Gucci will take in virtual worlds going forward. Learnings from Gucci Garden â€œ[inform] us about where we can place our bets in the longer term and how we can be much more scientific in what we're doing,â€ says Trefius.Â Additional Resources:Luxury Brands Gucci, Tiffany Dive Into NFTs Despite Slump: Kering SAâ€™s Gucci and LVMHâ€™s Tiffany & Co. take a leap into NFTs. Gucci adds the cryptocurrency to its roster as an additional way to purchase its products.Â How to Seize Fashionâ€™s Gaming Opportunity â€” Download the Case Study: In a BoF case study, Marc Bain discusses how fashion brands can benefit from expanding their reach into the video game industry.Â Gucci Teamed Up With Sims Community To Bring Its Off The Grid Collection To The Game: Nylon Magazine explains Gucciâ€™s collaboration with Sims 4 content creators Grimcookies and Harrie to bring the brandâ€™s Off the Grid collection into the game.Â  To learn more about the metaverse and other critical topics discussed in the podcast click here. All BoF Professional members can watch the BoF Professional Summit: An Inflection Point in Fashion Tech on demand.  Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

title: Vers un Ã©chec du Metaverse de Facebook ?
description: Le groupeÂ MetaÂ fondÃ© par Mark Zuckerberg, anciennement dÃ©nommÃ© Facebook, planche comme vous le savez sur le Metaverse, ce monde virtuel identique au mondeÂ rÃ©el, maisÂ aux possibilitÃ©sÂ quasi infinie.Â Si un grand nombre d'observateurs sontÂ enthousiastesÂ sur le concept, d'autres comme le fondateur de la cryptomonnaieÂ EthereumÂ sont beaucoup plus hostile.Â VitalikÂ ButerinÂ pense en effet que la technologie qu'essaye de dÃ©velopperÂ MetaÂ est un Ã©chec annoncÃ©.Â PourquoiÂ ?Â CommentÂ ?Â Toutes les explications dans cet Ã©pisode. Quand une personnalitÃ© commeÂ VitalikÂ ButerinÂ prend la parole sur un sujet technologique, on l'Ã©coute.Â En effet le fondateur de l'Ethereum, qui est quand mÃªme la seconde plus importante monnaie virtuelle du monde, annonce que leÂ MetaverseÂ est vouÃ© Ã  l'Ã©chec quand bien mÃªme son dÃ©veloppement n'en est qu'au tout dÃ©but...Â ouÂ tout du moins, c'est leÂ MetaverseÂ tel qu'imaginÃ© parÂ MetaÂ qui serait vouÃ© Ã  l'Ã©chec.Â Une prise de position qui ne sera pas pour redorer l'image deÂ MetaÂ dans ce dossier, le groupe ayant restructurÃ© sa division dÃ©diÃ©e auÂ MetaverseÂ avant l'Ã©tÃ©, je vous invite Ã  Ã©couter l'Ã©pisode qu'on y a consacrÃ© si ce n'est pas dÃ©jÃ  fait.Â Je cite le fondateur de l'Ethereum, Â«Â le Metaverse finira par exister, mais je pense qu'aucune des tentatives actuelles des entreprises de le crÃ©er intentionnellement nâ€™aboutiraÂ [â€¦]Â NousÂ ne connaissons pas encore vraiment la dÃ©finition du Metaverse, il est bien trop tÃ´t pour savoir ce que les gens veulent rÃ©ellement.Â Donc, tout ce que Facebook crÃ©e maintenant Ã©chouera Â» fin de citation. Si certaines stratÃ©gies marketing visent Ã  crÃ©er des besoins avant que les consommateurs ne les Ã©prouvent pour faire du business, dans le cas duÂ Metaverse,Â VitalikÂ ButerinÂ explique que cette faÃ§on de penser ne peut pas s'appliquer.Â Dans ce sens, une Ã©tude du cabinetÂ CensuswideÂ estime qu'il y a un gros dÃ©calage entre les attentes des consommateurs et les solutions dÃ©veloppÃ©es par les entreprises.Â Alors que la plupart des internautes interrogÃ©s veulent gagner du temps en faisant leurs achats en rÃ©alitÃ© virtuelle ou augmentÃ©e, les marques mettent quant Ã  elle au point de vÃ©ritable expÃ©riences virtuelles calquÃ©es sur le rÃ©el.Â En Europe, un sondage de la sociÃ©tÃ©Â SortalistÂ rÃ©vÃ¨le que la moitiÃ© des EuropÃ©ens se mÃ©fient du MetaverseÂ tel que prÃ©sentÃ© actuellement.Â Autre personnalitÃ© importanteÂ pointantÂ du doigtÂ le manque d'innovation du groupeÂ Meta,Â ReggieÂ Fils-AimÃ©.Â Ce nom ne vous dit peut-Ãªtre rien, et pourtant, il s'agit de l'ancien directeur de la branche amÃ©ricaine de Nintendo.Â Si l'on est nombreux Ã  imaginer leÂ MetaverseÂ comme une copie de la technologieÂ proposÃ©eÂ dans les films Matrix ouÂ ReadyÂ PlayerÂ One, Ã  savoir une copie virtuelle du monde rÃ©elle avec desÂ possibilitÃ©sÂ quasi infinie, la dÃ©finition qu'en donne Mark Zuckerberg est tout autre.Â Il s'agira jeÂ cite Â«Â d'espaces 3D qui vous permettront de socialiser, dâ€™apprendre, de collaborer et de jouer dâ€™une maniÃ¨re qui va au-delÃ  de ce que nous pouvons imaginerÂ Â».Â Rien de bien concret donc, comme le reprocheÂ Buterin. CÃ´tÃ© finance, de nombreux analystes sâ€™attendent Ã  ce que leÂ MetaverseÂ reprÃ©sente un immense marchÃ© dans les annÃ©es Ã  venir.Â Dâ€™aprÃ¨s la sociÃ©tÃ© de conseil et de rechercheÂ Technavion, le marchÃ© des mondes numÃ©riques atteindra plus de 50 milliards de dollars dâ€™ici Ã  2026.Â Pour sa part, le cabinet de conseil amÃ©ricain GrandÂ ViewÂ ResearchÂ voit plus grand, avec un marchÃ© de 678 milliards de dollars dâ€™ici Ã  2030.Â TroisiÃ¨me prÃ©diction venant de la sociÃ©tÃ©Â Gartner, 25 % des gens passeront au moins une heure par jour dans le MetaverseÂ en 2026...Â Ã Â condition que ce dernier soit au point dans 4 ans. title: 137. The Future is Now: An Introduction to Emerging Tech Like AI, Cryptocurrency, and the Metaverse with Ben Jorgenson
description: Discover how decentralized technologies are shaping our future! Join Ben Jorgenson, visionary, CEO and founder of Constellation Network, as he explores blockchain, cryptocurrency, and the frontier of Web 3. Ben simplifies complex concepts like decentralized networks, smart contracts, and blockchain's application to challenges like deep-fakes and data governance. Whether new or experienced, gain insights into blockchain's disruptive potential across industries.About Ben JorgensonBen Jorgensen specializes in emerging technologies such as blockchain, cryptocurrency, and Web 3. Contracted by the US Department of Defense, Constellation Network is creating an ecosystem for developers to integrate applications with existing Web 2 infrastructure using blockchain technology.Â Here are some power takeaways from todayâ€™s conversation:[04:05] Benâ€™s career background and how he found his way into blockchain[09:02] What is disruptive technology?[10:23] Understanding Web 3, blockchain, cryptocurrency, decentralized networking[17:33] Crypto technology and its potential uses[23:44] AI, data ownership, and governance[28:07] Blockchain's potential to validate AI and deep fake images[39:42] The potential of blockchain to simplify digital transactions and revolutionize the real estate industryÂ [45:08] Crypto regulations and fundraising with a crypto company ownerEpisode Highlights:[09:02] What is Disruptive Technology?Disruptive technology refers to anything that challenges societal norms and revolutionizes the way things are done. It breaks open established conventions, offering more efficient, cost-effective, and faster alternatives. Blockchain, for instance, has the potential to disrupt information exchange and validation, particularly in finance. Consider Bitcoin: do we really need multiple layers of institutions to send or receive money from one country to another, like from America to Amsterdam? It's about reimagining traditional processes and embracing innovative solutions that can reshape our world.Â [10:23] Understanding Web 3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Decentralized NetworkingWeb 3 encompasses various components, including metaverses - alternative digital worlds for immersive experiences - as recently highlighted by Facebook. Unlike traditional Web 2 technology, Web 3 introduces a more interactive and social aspect to online experiences. At its core is blockchain technology, enabling decentralized entities and transactions using cryptocurrency. This decentralized approach addresses concerns about data governance and control, offering the opportunity to reshape the socio-economic landscape and redefine information governance through Web 3.[39:42] Simplifying Digital Transactions and Revolutionizing The Real Estate Industry Through BlockchainBlockchain removes middlemen in digital transactions, automating processes through code-based trust. This enables seamless execution of contracts and title transfers, transforming the real estate industry. By streamlining the process and reducing human involvement, innovation in buying real estate and creating funds becomes immense. Embracing technology requires a broader perspective, recognizing its disruptive nature and the untapped potential of reducing intermediaries in real estate transactions.This show is for entertainment purposes only. Nothing said on the show should be considered financial advice. Before making any decisions, consult a professional. This show is copyrighted by Passive Investing from Left Field and Left Field Investors. Written permissions must be granted before syndication or rebroadcasting.Resources Mentioned:Constellation NetworkExponential Organizations by Salim IsmailAvoiding Rookie Errors as a Left Field Investor: 20 Lessons Learned From 14 Years of Passive Investing in Private Syndications by Steve SuhPodcast Recommendations:How Things Work PodcastAdvertising Partners:TribevestSpartan Investment GroupRise48Aspen Funds

title: Is the metaverse going to be sh*t?
description: Itâ€™s undeniable that technology is creeping further and further into our lives - but are we going to end up living inside a virtual reality? Mark Zuckerberg certainly hopes so.This episode, we uncover what the metaverse might look like, we examine some of its potential benefits (and take a critical view of just how good they actually are) and we consider some of the drawbacks. We also discover how close the metaverse is to becoming a reality and we find out whether anyone actually wants any of this in the first placeâ€¦Special thanks to todayâ€™s expert, Professor Victoria Baines. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

title: What is the Metaverse?
description: What exactly is the Metaverse? And is it really that new?This talk will explore our emotional connections to cyberspace, our feelings of presence and immediacy in online environments, and what this means for the intensity of our experiences, good and bad. As technology promises ever more immersive, embodied experiences involving 360 degree vision, touch, and even taste, how might this merging of cyber and physical affect our lives?A lecture by Professor Victoria BainesThe transcript and downloadable versions of the lecture are available from the Gresham College website: https://www.gresham.ac.uk/watch-now/metaverseGresham College has offered free public lectures for over 400 years, thanks to the generosity of our supporters. There are currently over 2,500 lectures free to access. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to learn from some of the greatest minds. To support Gresham's mission, please consider making a donation: https://gresham.ac.uk/support/Website:Â  https://gresham.ac.ukTwitter:Â  https://twitter.com/greshamcollegeFacebook: https://facebook.com/greshamcollegeInstagram: https://instagram.com/greshamcollegeSupport the show

title: Transmedia IP, Gaming, and the Metaverse
description: As "metaverses" gain in prominence, and more and more gameplay happens inside these digital worlds, brands, advertisers, and IP owners are naturally going to want to be there. Wherever there is consumer attention and engagement, there will always be brands wanting to get in front of these engaged audiences.Â But how should brands, which typically know nothing about gaming, engage with consumers in these spaces that are still fairly alien to them? What does a successful transmedia IP strategy look like? Does every brand need a transmedia strategy? To answer these questions your host, Niko Vuori, talks with Joe Ferencz, the founder and CEO of Gamefam, one of the largest metaverse developers that works with brands to bring their IP into the metaverse.Â To learn more, make sure to visit https://gamefam.com/. You can find Joe Ferencz on LinkedIn.Weâ€™d also like to thank Gamesight for making this episode possible! Gamesight provides full-service campaign management, taking charge of consulting, influencer discovery, relationship management, billing, and reporting, leaving you free to focus on your core business. To learn more, simply visit https://gamesight.io/Â If you like the episode, please help others find us by leaving a 5-star rating or review! And if you have any comments, requests, or feedback shoot us a note at podcast@naavik.co.Â Watch the episode: YouTube ChannelFor more episodes and details: Podcast WebsiteFree newsletter: Naavik DigestFollow us: Twitter | LinkedIn | WebsiteSound design by Gavin Mc Cabe.

title: Is the metaverse going to suck? A conversation with Matthew Ball
description: All right, letâ€™s talk about the metaverse.Â  You probably canâ€™t stop hearing about it. Itâ€™s in startup pitches, in earnings reports, some companies are creating metaverse divisions, and Mark Zuckerberg changed Facebookâ€™s name to Meta to signal that heâ€™s shifting the entire company to focus on the metaverse. The problem, very simply, is that no one knows what the metaverse is, what itâ€™s supposed to do, or why anyone should care about it. Luckily, we have some help. Today, Iâ€™m talking to Matthew Ball, who is the author of the new book called The Metaverse: And How It Will Revolutionize Everything. Matthew was the global head of strategy at Amazon Studios. In 2018, he left Amazon to become an analyst and started writing about the metaverse on his blog. Heâ€™s been writing about this since way before the hype exploded, and his book aims to be the best resource for understanding the metaverse, which he sees as the next phase of the internet. Itâ€™s not just something that you access through a VR headset, though thatâ€™s part of it. Itâ€™s how youâ€™ll interact with everything. That sort of change is where new companies have opportunities to unseat the old guard. This episode gets very in the weeds, but it really helped me understand the decisions some companies have made around building digital worlds and the technical challenges and business challenges that are slowing it down â€” or might even stop it. And, of course, I asked whether any of this is a good idea in the first place because, well, Iâ€™m not so sure. But thereâ€™s a lot here, so listen, and then you tell me. Links: Matthew Ball on TwitterÂ  Mark Zuckerberg on why Facebook is rebranding to MetaÂ  Microsoft, Meta, and others are founding a metaverse open standards group Android emoji will actually look human this year Appleâ€™s app tracking policy reportedly cost social media platforms nearly $10 billion Microsoft and Activision Blizzard: the latest news on the acquisition Microsoft HoloLens boss Alex Kipman is out after misconduct allegations European Parliament Think Tank memorandumâ€”Metaverse: Opportunities, risks and policy implications  Transcript: https://www.theverge.com/e/23033211  Credits: Decoder is a production of The Verge, and part of the Vox Media Podcast Network. Todayâ€™s episode was produced by Creighton DeSimone and Jackie McDermott and it was edited by Callie Wright. The Decoder music is by Breakmaster Cylinder. Our Sr Audio Director is Andrew Marino and our Executive Producer is Eleanor Donovan. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

title: Are video calls the best we can do in the age of the metaverse? | Josephine Eyre
description: Remote work, while redefining the workplace landscape, seems stuck behind endless video conference calls that hinder free-flowing conversation and collaboration. In the 21st century, is that really the best we can do? Digital anthropologist Josephine Eyre makes the case for embracing the metaverse as an immersive meeting place that could help reignite creativity and communication.

title: Samantha Radocchia: The Metaverse, AI, and the Ethics of Technology
description: Samantha Radocchia, or "Sam Rad," is a futurist, best-selling author, and frontier tech pioneer. She combines anthropology and technology to explore transformative ideas and technologies that will shape our future. As the founder of Radical Next, a meta-media studio, Sam creates experiences and media productions that shape the future. She is a charismatic speaker, delivering keynotes globally and empowering individuals, leaders, and organizations to thrive through radical change. With a background in anthropology and symbolic systems, Sam applies an ethnographic approach to envisioning future possibilities. She has founded multiple companies, holds patents bridging the physical and digital worlds, and is deeply passionate about decentralization. Sam is also an adventurous spirit, with over 700 skydiving jumps as a competitive skydiver.In our conversation, we will explore a range of thought-provoking topics. We will delve into the ethical considerations surrounding frontier technology, including the responsible development and deployment of emerging technologies, the implications of the emergence of AI technologies, the future of our society, of work, and of meaning, and the role technology plays in building a thriving society.Learn more about Sam's work - http://sam-rad.comFollow Sam across social @SamRadOfficialHighlights00:00 Intro01:15 Skydiving03:15 Anthropology and Technology08:45 The Metaverse: A New Reality or a Virtual Escape?16:25 Is Artificial Intelligence a God-Like Technology?25:00 Exponential Technologies Have Arrived.32:04 The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence.38:00 AI will Reveal our Bullshit Jobs.41:40 The Databases That AI is Being Trained on.46:15 Algorithms Run Our Decisions.54:01 Virtual Reality Headsets and Data Privacy.1:08:25 Predictions For The Future.1:15:00 Where To Find Sam.Thank you for tuning in! If you enjoyed this episode, share it with a loved one.Â If you are listening on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, rate the show and write a review with your thoughts -- I do read what you write and it helps more than you think!// LINKS //Website: https://throughconversations.comNewsletter: https://throughconversations.ck.page/0c18d1ab61// SOCIAL //Twitter: https://twitter.com/thruconvpodcastInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/thruconvpodcast/?hl=enYouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl67XqJVdVtBqiCWahS776g

title: The Metaverse: New frontiers or same old issues?
description: It's been billed as the future of the internet. But what exactly is 'The Metaverse'? One Sunday Times journalist takes a journey into the the virtual-reality world. It may be for over-13s, but she found harassment, racism and talk of porn make it scary even for adults.This podcast was brought to you thanks to the support of readers of The Times and The Sunday Times. Subscribe today and get one month free at: thetimes.co.uk/storiesofourtimes.Guest:Â Louise Eccles, Consumer Affairs Editor, The Sunday Times.Host:Â David Aaronovitch.Clips: Sky News, CNBC, CNET, Meta, WION, Microsoft Ignite. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

title: S2 EPISODE 32: Brahim Boujida, HR Director Belgium & Luxembourg bij Accenture, over onbenutte talentenpools, inclusief organisatiebeleid en de metaverse op de werkvloer.
description: In de eerste aflevering van ons nieuwe topic teammanagement gaan we in gesprek met Brahim Boujida, een ervaren professional op het gebied van human resources en recruitment. Brahim begon zijn loopbaan bij Orange, maar maakte pas echt de overstap naar hr toen hij bij The Adecco Group aan de slag ging. Gedurende zijn carriÃ¨re heeft hij diverse functies bekleed binnen hr en sales, en uiteindelijk belandde hij bij Accenture als hr-partner. Inmiddels, twaalf jaar later, is hij binnen Accenture hr-verantwoordelijke voor BelgiÃ« en Luxemburg.  Ons gesprek brengt ons bij het thema inclusief leiderschap en organisatiebeleid, een pijler waar Accenture zich hard voor inzet. Brahim neemt ons mee in de evolutie van teammanagement en legt uit hoe een open feedbackcultuur kan bijdragen aan duurzame rekruteringsprocessen en positieve werkervaringen. Hij deelt zijn visie op de â€˜war for talentâ€™, en benadrukt het belang van partners en netwerken om toegang te krijgen tot een bredere talentenpool.  Verder gaan we in op het wereldwijde succes van Accenture, en belichten we de rol die diversiteit en inclusie daarin vervullen. Brahim geeft ook zijn visie op de toekomst van flexibele werkvormen, zoals thuiswerken en inclusief verlofbeleid. En hij kadert de impact van virtual reality en de metaverse op de werkvloer. Als we drie tips uit ons gesprek zouden moeten kiezen, dan staan deze ongetwijfeld bovenaan de lijst: praat met mensen, wees flexibel en houd het simpel.

title: What is the future of the Metaverse?  | RC008
description: Recently Facebook announced the company will be diving head first in the Metaverse. So what really is the Metaverse? Join us, as we get rebelliously curious.   *You can also watch Chrissy Newton's interview on YouTube at The Debrief.
